meanings.definition: A person who creates myths or legends.
meanings.sent1: The mythologizers in the ancient tribe told stories around the fire.
meanings.sent2: The mythologizers added magical creatures to the tale to make it more exciting.
meanings.sent3: The mythologizers' stories were so captivating that even the animals listened intently.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination soared like a flock of mythologizers creating new worlds.
meanings.sent5: The children were mesmerized by the mythologizers' enchanting tales.

meanings.definition: Those who embellish or exaggerate stories or events.
meanings.sent1: Some mythologizers tend to make ordinary events sound extraordinary.
meanings.sent2: The group of mythologizers at the party made the evening seem like a grand adventure.
meanings.sent3: The mythologizers' version of the fishing trip involved battling sea monsters.
meanings.sent4: Her friend was known as the mythologizer of the group, always adding drama to stories.
meanings.sent5: The mythologizers' retelling of the storm made it sound like a legendary battle.

meanings.definition: Individuals who interpret or analyze myths.
meanings.sent1: The mythologizers studied ancient texts to understand the meaning behind the myths.
meanings.sent2: As mythologizers, they delved deep into the symbolism of each story.
meanings.sent3: The mythologizers debated the true intentions of the gods in the myths.
meanings.sent4: Their role as mythologizers was to unravel the mysteries hidden within the legends.
meanings.sent5: The mythologizers' insights shed light on the cultural significance of the myths.
